page.title: 04Ecology and Conservation
page.content: The inhabitants are very conscious of the need to conserve our habitat and many are actively involved. One half acre site has been planted by Avon Wildlife Trust for a local farmer with 2oo native deciduous trees. These will be gradually thinned out to leave a wood of larger broad leaved trees. The oak sapplings are enclosed in square plastic cases 1.5 metres high and 7.5 cms. wide, shown to induce faster growth. There are many footpaths and bridle_paths in the area but because of the clay beneath these are very muddy after heavy rain. The local W.I.and other organisations arrange members' walks on some paths to ensure these are kept open. Some have been lost through disuse. The farmers maintain the footbridges where paths cross ditches or rhines still in use.
